rev: I can respect the US white ethnic group; but contest the given name American without reference
those are not ethnic terms; Washington had ethnicity, not just a social class--like anybody else and you WILL AFFORD US RESPECT
revert. Argument is nonsense: [[WASP]] or [[Yankee]], may qualify if you want to introduce upperclass white US ethnic groups but not American
It is not right to disqualify Americans such as George Washington from having their own ethnic background; we are not all hyphenated immigrants

BOT - rv [[Special:Contributions/212.85.1.38|212.85.1.38]] ([[User talk:212.85.1.38|talk]]) to last version by Lumos3
as yo ucan see, we are all 99% the same, whether within or without the group, you misunderstood the information and there are cases where some ethnic groups do reach a "racial" level of difference
the 85-15% is within the range of genes shared by all humans
/* See also */ added [[Race]] - how can this article not even mention the term "race" and [[Race]] not even mention [[ethnicity]]???
you misunderstand what you read, all humans are 99% genetically similar and the differences within members of a group obviously arent any more than that with those outside of the group
no, the 85% is within an ethnic group, not all humans; the number for all humans is no more than 15%, in most extreme case
those 85% differences within the group is that between ALL humans and there are some cases where the differences reach a "racial" level, whatever is meant by the term.
no, not even close; the avearge diff. btwn the most distant ethnic groups does not exceed 15%, while differences within ethnic groups are as high as 85%
i also disagree, there are some cases in which this is true and group are of a specific "sub-type"
there are no such cases; not even close
there are cases where the differences do approach a "racial" level
umm, what does this photo have to do with this article, lol
is this wikipedia for American spelling or Canadian/British spelling ? I don't know..
